text: The Roman Catholic Diocese of Gaborone () is a diocese located in the city of Gaborone, Botswana, in the Ecclesiastical province of Pretoria in South Africa. The motto of the diocese is ', which means "God is love." ==History== * 24 April 1959: Established as Apostolic Prefecture of Bechuanaland from the Diocese of Bulawayo in Zimbabwe, Diocese of Kimberley in South Africa and Apostolic Vicariate of Windhoek in Namibia * 5 August 1966: Promoted as Diocese of Gaberones * 7 April 1970: Renamed as Diocese of Gaborone ==Special churches== * The cathedral is Christ the King Cathedral in Gaborone. ==Leadership== * Prefect Apostolic of Bechuanaland (Roman rite) ** Fr. Urban Charles Joseph Murphy, C.P. (24 April 1959 – 5 August 1966); see below * Bishop of Gaberones (Roman rite) ** Bishop Urban Charles Joseph Murphy, C.P. (5 August 1966 – 7 April 1970); see above & below * Bishops of Gaborone (Roman rite) ** Bishop Urban Charles Joseph Murphy, C.P. (7 April 1970 – 28 February 1981); see above ** Bishop Boniface Tshosa Setlalekgosi (30 November 1981 – 5 February 2009) ** Bishop Valentine Tsamma Seane (5 February 2009 – 9 August 2017) ** Bishop Franklyn (Frank) Atese Nubuasah, S.V.D. (6 June 2019 -) ==See also== *Roman Catholicism in Botswana ==References== ==External links== * GCatholic.org * Catholic Hierarchy Category:Christian organizations established in 1959 Category:Roman Catholic dioceses and prelatures established in the 20th century
title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Gaborone
